org.opensha.eq.forecast

Class Forecast

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opensha.eq.forecast.Forecast
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<SourceSet<? extends Source>>

    public final class Forecast
extends Object
implements Iterable<SourceSet<? extends Source>>
    A Forecast is the top-level wrapper for earthquake source definitions used in probabilisitic seismic hazard analyses and calculations (PSHAs). A Forecast contains of a number of SourceSets that define logical groupings of sources by type and iterates over them in the order that SourceTypes are declared. SourceSets by type ruptures to be used in a .

    Iteration of SourceSets occurs in the order that SourceTypes are declared in their enum class and then by the order they were added to this Forecast

    Author:
    Peter Powers
    See Also:
    SourceSet, SourceType
